caption: La Villette is less of a green park and more of a cultural space with playgrounds, the science center, a food hall, trails, and more. It took me around 12 minutes to walk through from end to end. For a unique playground, go to the dragon-themed one with a gigantic slide.
Beautiful park to stroll through. I love the big sphere outside and all the big old trees.

Nice concert venue in a big park. Went to see Glass Animals and had a great time. At least three concession stands to buy a variety of drinks and snacks from. Clean bathrooms. Good location by McDonald’s and metro.

Excellent concert with Rod Stewart, but was disappointed with the crowd who never really got "Into the groove " and only rose from their seats for a couple of songs. Kinda ruined the atmosphere, but not for me,!!  I never sat down once!!

The science museum had mixed reviews but I don't understand it. The exhibitions were great! You can spend a full day here or maybe 2! Everything was updated with info from 2023 Space X achievements. It was amazing to see inside a submarine.  It was easy to book the timeslots online. There's a restaurant and kiosk and even burger king on ground floor. The only downside was that the planetarium show was very informative but completely in French. I thought it would be more visual so the language wouldn't matter but it was still nice.

Highly recommend this park!  I went and spend 3 hours and had an amazing time just walking around and exploring.  I didn't have to spend a single dollar but I am sure there are plenty of things that you can do there as well that cost money.  I was out for a cheap day though and was very compensated.
Very nice parc with lots of things around! We attend the Club de France for the Paralympics and it was awesome

It’s always nice to walk around La Villette. The 90s architecture is fun and on week ends you have a lot of activities. The geode will reopen this spring and I can’t wait to experience this new movie attraction. Just enjoy the time and have fun

My experience of this place has been limited to four memorable visits to the Philharmonie de Paris, but I have witnessed events taking place in the public spaces and passed by the enticing Cafe de la Musique numerous times. All in all this is a public space tailored to a broad variety of interests, and in particular, catering to those who care about the performing arts. If I lived in Paris I’d probably visit at least once a month.
Very interesting place. I have visited it during Olympic games.

We came in the winter and very little was open on what is a prime day a Saturday. Kids playgrounds were empty and it was desolate. The place has so much potential and the follies are beautiful and a great way to connect the park. Needs more website live info of events
As a traveller I would suggest that maybe you can skip it as there are better places.  But if you are staying for a while then you should see it. Beautiful park and an awesome place for jogging.
Great museum for young and old; just wear cool clothing in the summer months cause there is no AC. Fabulous classes are available for those that live there.

We had no idea there was such a great food court here as our trip was so short we didn't see this until we travelled to La villette to get the coach to the airport.. so many different types of food to try the building itself was clean and well decorated.

What a beautiful urban park with great local participation. It’s wonderful to see a park so well used by its local community. The architecture is also wonderful. A very successful master planning example that I wish my own city has to offer

Very nice place for family and friends! If you are going with your children they have a huge park that has many activities for the children to do. There is also plenty of green space to sit on the grass, relax, have a date. You can also ride your bike, scooters or skate!
It's a great place to bring your kids when you are traveling to Paris, I would recommend going during the week when all Parisien kids are at school.

Loads of play areas and green space for young children alongside the canal where it's well designed for walking and cycling. Supervised play area that is manned by park keepers to maintain the quality of the equipment. Workshops on offer to entertain little ones on a variety of activities. Fun statues dotted around too. Feels safe, well thought out and we'll resourced to keep it nice. Easily spend half a day or a whole day too.
A lot of fun activities for families, kids, young and adults; plage to boating, music to food everything !
Beautiful open space for fun and family time. Dragon Park is a must!

Perfect place for the family on a warm day in Paris. A bit far off the beaten track but the mall and hall of science and industry are cool. Perfect setting for a bike or boat rental. Many kiosk and cafe for ice cream , snacks, adult beverage.  The savage Cabaret sculptures that line the parks and river are very cool. Really nice slides and climbing walls for all ages. Many things closed because summer or covid. We had read about the little city and have always wanted to go. Finally went and would go back to explore again. Easy metro ride on the 7 line from central Paris.
Beautiful park with many great details.

Saw Alt-J here this autumn and actually quite liked the venue! People seemed friendly and helpful and it was easy to find your way around. One thing that was less convenient was that there were only 3 toilets available for each men and women… There were always queues as there were around 3000 people there. Other than that, very nice place!
It was a nice evening, the park was full of lights. Awesome light show. Entry ticket €22 for adults.

We went to see the Tim Burton exhibition, Le labyrint. The park was a nice addition to the overall urban vibe of Paris. Plenty of activities. From eating and drinking to chilking in the park, playground for kids and pets.

Nice place not far from Paris downtown. Art, music, dance, little boat by rent, playground for kids and grassfield for all people that want to stay in relax. Is located at the end of Canal St.Martin. Reachable by Metro or by original boat tour starts from Place de la Bastille.
Great parc in North Paris with a Wide range of cultural venues for art exhibitions, concerts and other cultural events. A must of do while visiting Paris.

Beautiful park, rich in vegetation and meadows .. there are areas where you can have your meal with equipped areas. fun for children and also for adults with an exhibition dedicated to Napoleon. and areas where to play sports, open-air cinema and much more. beautiful day.
So vibrant during this JO de Paris 24

Pretty cool place. We went to the La Grande Halle for an exposition. It is quite nice. There is a lot to do there. Or you can just take a stroll around all the buildings and the Canal St Martin. I would suggest finding out what exposition there is there when you go to Paris.

The open air cinema is situated in this lovely place, happening annually from mid-July to mid-Aug. Screen is way bigger than expected, and there's really a huge crowd with a relaxing atmosphere, great for an after work chill with friends and family. Remember to bring your own chair/mat!

It's very family friendly, with many carousels and other attractions for kids. The canal runs through it which is nice and there's plenty of space to sit on the grass and have a picnic or coffee by the water.

One of the best live houses you can find in Paris. The space is big enough but with a nice air conditioning system. Audio Video experience is great and it is accessable from almost everywhere in the room. Drinks and hotdog are served just next to the entrance. Attention: there is no locker or storage place for clothes but only for helmet.
Excellent park for friends and family. Full of cultural and music activities. Best to visit in all seasons especially the summer and spring where you can find many interesting activities.

Arranged as an Olympic park with pavilions from different countries. The best party was at the Brasil one, the largest was for France. Very hot inside so sat outside to watch the big screen. Only showed events with French athletes.

A big and nice parc in Paris. A lot of activities to do doesn't matter if you're a child, an adult or a dog; you'll always find something to do. Crowded on Sundays and on sunny days (which in Autumn is weird and well appreciated in Paris). Nice for a picnic.

I went to the plage here. There were three swimming pools. One really shallow fir kids, the second medium depth were u can stand and swim and the third is deep. The atmosphere was great, the plage was clean with a small sand area and there were lookers for day use too for a 1euro coin that you can take when back when you leave.

A special bit of late 20th century design which has evolved a little over the years. Off the main Paris tourist trail and worth a visit. We went on a cold, snowy February day - I bet it’s stunning in summer.
